contentrichtext.text: {{no footnotes|date=January 2013}} '''Sint-Maria-Lierde''' is a small [[village]] which makes up part of the [[municipality]] of [[Lierde]]. It is located in the [[Denderarea]] and in the [[Flemish Ardennes]], the hilly southern part of the [[Belgium|Belgian]] [[province]] of [[East Flanders]]. The village's [[coat of arms]] shows a [[heart]] of [[Jesus]] beneath a [[Crown (headgear)|crown]]. The arms were granted in 1818 and confirmed on December 20, 1846. == External links == * [http://www.lierde.be/sit013.htm Page on Sint-Maria-Lierde] from the official Lierde website (only available in [[Dutch language|Dutch]]) * [http://www.ngw.nl/int/bel/s/s-marial.htm Coat of arms] from the International Civic Arms website * [http://www.reocities.com/belgiumtowns/stmarialierdekerk.html Webpage at Reocities] {{EastFlanders-geo-stub}} {{coord|50|49|N|3|51|E|region:BE_type:city|display=title}} [[Category:Populated places in Belgium]] [[Category:Lierde]]
